intro: Reinwardtiodendron anamalaiense, commonly known as the Anamalai mountain ash, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in moist, shaded forest habitats. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and distinctive yellowish or greenish flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
